title: VERA FILES FACT CHECK: Roque makes false claim to justify swimming with dolphins
subtitle: In justifying his recent “side trip” to the Ocean Adventure park in Subic, Zambales, Presidential Spokesperson Harry Roque falsely claimed he did not violate any health and quarantine regulations.
author: verafiles.org
vclaim:
In justifying his recent “side trip” to the Ocean Adventure park in Subic, Zambales, Presidential Spokesperson Harry Roque claimed he did not violate any health and quarantine regulations.

This is false. Watch this video:

Under modified general community quarantine (MGCQ) -- a -- swimming and other “non-contact sports” are allowed as long as minimum public health standards, such as wearing of masks and maintaining the prescribed physical distance of at least one meter , are practiced.

Roque, who also serves as the spokesperson of the Inter-agency Task Force for the Management of Emerging Infectious Diseases, is not the first public official criticized for alleged breach of health and quarantine protocols.

In early June, San Juan City Mayor Francisco Zamora drew flak after his convoy avoided health inspection at a checkpoint in Baguio City. (See VERA FILES FACT SHEET: No such thing as ‘cancer-free,’ oncologist says )
